attributes.action: Reduce the age of cervical screening back to 20 for women in England
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In light of Jade Goody now bravely facing terminal cervical cancer this highlights that the women of England should have access to cervical screening from the age of 20 as it is in all other areas of the UK. Cancer Research UK states that more research is needed to establish exactly which age ranges should be screened and sensibly Scotland Wales and Ireland are waiting for this research before excluding women under 25.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
